parameter.help: The plugins in the dropdown menu below that are italicized require third-party libraries that might not be installed on your system. Please also note that several plugins rely on the station ID to build the output file name (so if you change the station ID in the input or inputEditing, this would change the output file name).

parameter.label: Select METEO data plugin:

parameter.help: Path to the meteorological files; this path must exist, it won't be created

option.help: BUFR files [more…]. Filenames will be generated on the fly
PostgreS output (not suitable for most users) [more…]

parameter.help: Path to the SNOWPACK files; this path MUST exist, it won't be created

option.help: Text format that can be read by the WISKI database environment [more…]

parameter.help: See MeteoIO's help for more information
Path where BUFR files should be saved
Should each station be saved in a separate file?
Should the CryoStation format be used?
WIGOS ID series number
WIGOS ID issuer
WIGOS ID issue number
WIGOS local ID
Station type: 0|Automatic; 1|Manned; 2|Hybrid; 3|Missing (default: 3)

Surface type: 0|Open Ocean or Semi-Enclosed Sea; 1|Enclosed Sea or Lake; 2|Continental Ice; 3|Land; 4|Low Inland(below sea level); 5|Mix of Land and Water; 6|Mix of Land and Low Inland; 11|River; 12|Lake; 13|Sea; 14|Glacier; 15|Urban Land; 16|Rural Land; 17|Suburban Land; 18|Sea Ice; 255|Missing Value (default: 255)
Method of snow depth measurement: 0|Manual; 1|Ultrasonic; 2|Video Camera; 3|Laser; 14|Others; 15|Missing Value (default: 15)
Should additional information be printed?
Path to the data files
prefix to append when generating a file name for reading
specifiy in which order the columns should be printed out
Path to the data files
Absolute filename of the metadata file
force all stations to be contained in a single file?
Data schema to use (i. e. mostly variables and dimensions naming)
only write out parameters that are specifically described in the chosen schema?
write out all provided parameters even if no metadata can be associated with them?

For some applications, some extra information (meteorological measurements reference height ZREF, wind measurements reference height UREF) must be provided for meteorological time series (for example, for Crocus)
For some applications, some extra information (default slope and azimuth) must be provided for meteorological time series (for example, for Crocus)

parameter.label: Write ACDD metadata
parameter.help: fill ACDD metadata fields (see MeteoIO's help for more information)
keep files open for efficient access? Beware, simulateous writing to a file in the case of parallelized processing could lead to data corruption (default: false)
Database URL
Database port to use for connection
Database name
Query to retrieve the metadata. For example, SELECT id, station_name AS name, x_coord AS x, y_coord AS y, z AS altitude, epsg from all_stations WHERE id IN
Directory to save your SMET data output files in
Either write an ascii file (default) or a binary one
create multiple versions of a given dataset by appending additional information to the filename (default: no such versioning)
should the plotting headers (to help make more meaningful plots) be included in the outputs? (default: true)
for variables where no predefined colors are available, either specify grey or random colors (default: false)
default number of decimals for parameters that don't already define it (default: 3)
default number of characters for parameters that don't already define it (default: 8)
when an output file already exists, should the plugin try to append data? (default: false)
when an output file already exists, should the plugin overwrite it? (default: true)

parameter.label: Write ACDD metadata
parameter.help: Should ACDD metadata be written in the header? (default: false)
The options below make it easy to import smet files into various softwares that expect very basic CSV syntax but at the cost of making the smet files non-conformant
Set a different column delimiter, the posix expression [:space:] represents any combination of white spaces (default: white spaces)
Prefix all header lines with a '#' character? (default: false)
Directory to save your iCSV data output files in
File extension for the output files (default: .icsv)
The delimiter used in the output file (default: ,)
when an output file already exists, should the plugin try to append data? (default: false)
when an output file already exists, should the plugin overwrite it? (default: true)

parameter.label: Write ACDD metadata
parameter.help: Should ACDD metadata be written in the header? (default: false)
Directory to save your SMET data output files in
The file extension for ZRXP files, the delimiter used to separate the header fields, and the value given to WISKI to interpret as missing data (default: MeteoIO's nodata, usually -999)

parameter.label: Write out units:

o.help: Units respected by the WISKI import

o.h: Units transported as comment, not used in WISKI import

parameter.help: Controls whether MeteoIO's stored units for the parameters are written out

parameter.caption: Use local character encoding
parameter.help: Encode non-ASCII characters on the operating system running the program

parameter.caption: Write internal paramater indices
parameter.help: Outputs MeteoIO's internal parameter index

parameter.caption: Output parameters processed to nodata
parameter.help: Parameters that are nodata throughout will be output if at least one nodata is the result of processing

parameter.label: Enter remark:
parameter.help: A remark that is passed through to each output line

The following are status values that are set depending on how the meteo value was processed:
  • Status to give for data that was checked and left unaltered
  • Status for temporally interpolated data
  • Status for filtered (changed) data
  • Status for data originating from a MeteoIO generator
  • Status for nodata values (default: disabled, has priority over all others)
  • Status for when nodata is already present in the input file and left untouched

The Attribute Convention for Data Discovery (ACDD) describes attributes recommended for describing a dataset to discovery systems such as Digital Libraries. This helps systems and users locate and use data efficiently. Please have a look at the list of attribues with their definitions.
a short title for the data set
a paragraph describing the dataset
a file containing a description of the dataset, it overwrites the value of ACDD_SUMMARY if present
a comma-separated list of GCMD Science Keywords terms or terms fron another vocabulary (provided with their full path)
the unique name or identifier of the vocabulary from which keywords are taken (default: GCMD Science Keywords (GCMDSK))
miscellaneous informartion about the dataset
acknowledgement for the various types of support for the project that produced this data

frame.caption: Linking the dataset to other resources and metadata

parameter.help: although this is not an ACDD key, it can be very useful in linking datasets together through their WIGOS ID
an identifier for the data set, provided by and unique within its naming authority. Example: DOI, URL, text string, but without white spaces
the organization that provides the initial id for the dataset
Published or web-based references that describe the data or methods used to produce it
A URL/DOI that gives more complete metadata
the source and method of production of the original data
the scientific project that created the data
the overarching program(s) of which the dataset is a part;
Controlled vocabulary used to describe activity types, see the specification for more

frame.caption: Contact information regarding the data set

parameter.help: These attributes should help contacting those involved in every step from the creation of the dataset to its publication. In order to properly acknowledge all contributions, these fields can all be comma seperated lists (white spaces around the commas are allowed) but all matching fields must contain the same number of elements. For example if there are 3 names provided in ACDD_CREATOR, then there must also be 3 emails provided in ACDD_CREATOR_EMAIL (in the same order as the 3 names).
Name of the creator(s) of the data set
Email(s) of the creator(s)
Institution(s) of the creator(s)
URL of the creator(s)
Type of creator(s), choosen from (person|group|institution|position)
Name of the person(s) / entity(ies) responsible for publishing the data file or product to users, with its current metadata and format
Email of the publisher(s)
the URL of the publisher
Type of publisher(s), choosen from (person|group|institution|position)
Name of the person(s) / entity(ies) who has/have contributed to the data set (such as by providing data, maintaining the instruments, ...)
Role of the contributor(s)
Institution providing the data set (this is a legacy field, only one entry)
describes the license applicable to the dataset (in the form {url} ({license abbreviation}) as found in the SPDX License List)
version identifier of the data file or product as assigned by the data creator
a textual description of the processing level
Controlled vocabulary used to describe the operational status, see the specification for more
